Posts.Content: Hi Chuck and Pratoman Thank you for your comments and suggestions. I do have BPH due to enlarged prostate. In fact, in 2006 I did undergo a Green light laser PVP treatment to open up the urethral tract of my prostate. After the surgery my my urinay flow restrictions were eliminated. My last urologist told me after the negative biopsy in 2012 that I might be having some issues with prostate inflammation and infections from time to time. But he did not prescribe any antibiotics. When I see a new urologist on Feb 9, before doing another biopsy , I will ask him to give me Cipro for two weeks and then check my PSA. Next I will get a MR Imaging of biopsy at Virginia Commonwealth University, Richmond. It is a very advanced technique which is non invasive and lasts for 45 minutes and can detect cancerous lesions or tumors with almost 85 pct accuracy as they claim. If the MRI images show suspicious areas then I will have to go back to them for a MRI/Ultrasound fusion biopsy of the prostate. So this is my plan. I will welcome all comments and suggestions from the members of the forum. Thank you. Ron
Posts.Title: High PSA levels

Posts.Content: I am 75 years old in good health. I have a history of high PSA levels since 2003. I had three needle biopsies as follows: Sept 2004..12 core needle biopsy ..PSA 5.4 . all 12cores negative Oct 2006 ...12core needle biopsy ..PSA 6.3. All 12 cores negative PSA fluctuated as follows: 4/2007(5.5)...5/2008 ( 5.4)....6/2009 ( 7.6)....6/2010 (7.0)... 8 /2011 (6.6) ...9/2012 ( 10.5)...10/2012. (9.6) October 2012 .. 18 core needle biopsy...all 18 cores negative For the next several years my primary care doctor did my PSA tests and DREs and found no nodules or bumps. PSA fluctuated as follows: 6/2014...( 9....1/2015....( 7.7),,,7/2015,,,(11.47),,1/2016....( 9.5)....6/2016...(11.17) jan 2017. ...PSA 15.88 I am scheduled to see an urologist on Feb 9 . I will ask him to do a MRI/Ultrasound Fusion biopsy to accurately detect cancer. I do not have any symptoms or pains and feel well. I have enlarged prostate. But based on my research on the internet and reading messages posted by various members with prostate cancer thank you
Posts.Title: High PSA levels
